comment.author: 16830149@N02
comment._content:
Taken from British Army WW1 Medal Card Index
Alfred Goodwin Sharp - 1/4 London Regiment, Lahore Div. 2/Lt.
Theatre of War: France - Sept 1915
Free BMD & 1911 Census: Born 1895 Handsworth, Staffordshire (died 5 Jan 1924 Hertfordshire, Mertons Lodge, Lyonsdown Road, New Barnett) son of John Alfred Sharp (a Wesleyan Minister) and Alice Fannie Sharp. Siblings: Norman Hoffe Sharp, Margaret Eileen Sharp & Doris Mary Sophia Sharp.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Private Alfred Goodwin Sharp from the 2nd (City of London) Battalion, the London Regiment was gazetted 2nd Lieutenant on 16th January, 1915. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29041/supplements/494 A will is found for Alfred Goodwin Sharp - died 1924 - at ancestry.co.uk Index of Wills and Administrations. Also at ancestry.co.uk London, England, Freedom of the City Admission Papers, Name: Alfred Goodwin Sharp Father: John Alfred Sharp

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: This will be his father - Rev John Alfred Sharp (Jul 25, 1856 - Mar 4, 1932), an author of at least one book in the UK. www.authorandbookinfo.com/cgi-bin/auth.pl?S002719 (According to FreeBMD, birth of John Alfred Sharp was registered 3rd qr 1856 in Shaftesbury and died in Hertfordshire 1932. That's the county for New Barnet .) In the 1881 Census (free search at findmypast.co.uk) Residence: Didsbury Wesleyan Theological College, Didsbury , County of Lancashire SHARP, John Alfred Boarder Single M 24 1857 Theological Student b Shaftesbury Dorset
